title: Why all this hate for GGMF?!?

replies.body: MF's skin is literally 4 Chromas (oh slightly different guns, whoop dee doo) and rips animations straight from her base model. It's an objectively lazy skin for an absurdly high price, but I guarantee you if it was priced as a Legendary (what it deserves to be at) nobody would bat an eye.

Then why not the same hate for fckin udyr?! His ultimate is literally a prettier version of his base skin. It doesn't even fulfill a different fantasy.
Lux - Element Kween
Sona - DJ kweeeen
Ezreal - Some scifi shit
Udyr - ???

Yet you all bought the shit out of that skin lol

Different release dates. Back in the day, Magnificent TF was expensive, but was a pretty big deal. Same with Udyr's skin. It was a big deal at the time and one of the first "major" skin with a ton of visuals and what not added to it. 

With all the technology Rito has now, the expectations are a lot more.

> MF's skin is literally 4 Chromas

No it is not. Go watch the skin spotlight for it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vS_WTzDI7J4

All four suits have entirely different models and particle effects.

And Riot acknowledges that it's not quite as good as other ultimate skins. Hence why it's not at the same price as the other 4 ultimates.

Very minuscule change between forms. Small particle changes, and sound but legendary can do the same. The only notable changes are the ult stance she does and the gun design. I still think it needs to be pull back instead of making it a cheap ultimate skin, I rather have it as an actual ultimate skin. Hence why people angry about. Also note worthy is animations are not as impressive and seem to way too similar  compared to lux's skin and even some legendary skins have different animations. To me the GGMF is just a upgraded legendary rather then Ultimate which the feature of switch skins in game is the only thing keeps close to ultimate tier. I'm also disappointed that even if they acknowledge it they rather sell the skin in its state now rather then making a true ultimate skin. Just feels betrayed with their standards of making ultimate skins and just selling this lesser *ultimate* skin.

EDIT: https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/82iu8o/gun_goddess_mf_shouldnt_be_ultimate_and_here_is/

Even riot said themselves the skin doesn't live up to the ultimate skin title so they reduce the price a little but people don't want that. Easy to brush it all off as banter, when there's so much misinformation, and engagement in hyperbole
legendary skins have custom running idling animations. GGMF has Classic ones. Not even worth 1850. Just release 4 1350 skins

1. Her voice sounds off.
2. Her look seems off (minus the bobs, which are part and parcel of MF)
3. Elemental Lux first needs to build up energy, then you choose an element to "evolve" into. Your skin's colour then corresponds to that element. Moreover, you can then mix elements for secondary elements. Moreover, these are permanent. GGMF's colours could have been anything. Switching at will between colours doesn't feel "earned", and moreover the colours themselves are arbitrary.
4. MF has MANY skins already... quality skins at that. I know riot has an analytics team, and the higher ups get the report and say "MF sells most skins, we need more $$". It is what it is.

Not an awful skin, but nothing original, funny, scary, sexy, different, risky about it. Just a very safe "goliath mech" skin. It appeals to the West, appeals to the East.

I have a couple of MF skins, but for me, MF is one of the champs where her base skin is one of her best.

It is just a bandwagon, kids need to be mad about something to feel like they matter, so they pick this.

It will be back to yasuo OP / buff yasuo next month.

Are you serious, they have legit arguments that does make sense and you just brush off as banter? Even riot said themselves the skin doesn't live up to the ultimate skin title so they reduce the price a little but people don't want that. They want a legitimate ultimate skin, not a lesser ultimate or a upgraded legendary.

The general gist of the dislike is something along the lines of: 

"The skin still uses base MF's animations in some places. It's a glorified 1820 that isn't worth being called ultimate. Good thing is Riot realised this and made it cost less than the other ultimate skins."

Because every season we get excited to find out who is going to get the Legendary skin. It is frustrating when it is an adc, especially considering all the attention the class already gets. Also frustrating to see how inferior in quality it is when compared to other Legendary skins. Honestly if it was a dank skin I probably wouldn't be as frustrated, but I feel BAD for the MF mains who have to sit knowing that's the highest quality skin they'll probably ever see for their favorite champion. I pray Riot pulls the skin until the end of the season and puts a lot more work into it.
